title: Communications Services Up As Elliott Takes AT&T Interest - Communications Services Roundup
text:
Communications services companies rose as an activist investor took an interest in one of the largest U.S. cellphone carriers.

Shares of AT&T rallied after activist investor Elliott Management disclosed a $3.2 billion dollar stake in the telecom giant, and called for the sale of assets without a clear strategic rationale. Elliott has a long track record of pressuring mid-sized corporations into strategic changes but it's unclear whether its stake in AT&T, which amounts to roughly 1% of outstanding shares, will give it enough sway in the boardroom. Among the assets that Elliott could push AT&T to sell are its Mexican wireless-phone business and its DirecTV satellite business.

Shares of Google parent Alphabet fell slightly after attorneys general from all 50 states formally unveiled an antitrust probe of Google's operations.

Interpublic promoted longtime executive Philippe Krakowsky to a newly created position of chief operating officer, putting him in line to succeed Chief Executive Michael Roth.
